body:
Hi, i still have had this grpc_cpp_plugin error.
Before this problem, i had a error  in grpc/third_party/protobuf
so, I edited Makefile like below and solved libprotobuf error.

$(LIBDIR)/$(CONFIG)/protobuf/libprotobuf.a: third_party/protobuf/configure
    $(E) "[MAKE]    Building protobuf"
    $(Q)(cd third_party/protobuf ; CC="$(CC)" CXX="$(CXX)" LDFLAGS="$(LDFLAGS_$(CONFIG)) -g $(PROTOBUF_LDFLAGS_EXTRA)" CPPFLAGS="$(PIC_CPPFLAGS) $(CPPFLAGS_$(CONFIG)) -g $(PROTOBUF_CPPFLAGS_EXTRA)" **./configure --host=arm-xxxx-linux CC=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-gcc CXX=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-g++ --with-protoc=/usr/bin/protoc --disable-shared --enable-static)**
    $(Q)$(MAKE) -C third_party/protobuf clean
    $(Q)$(MAKE) -C third_party/protobuf
    $(Q)mkdir -p $(LIBDIR)/$(CONFIG)/protobuf
    $(Q)mkdir -p $(BINDIR)/$(CONFIG)/protobuf
    $(Q)cp third_party/protobuf/src/.libs/libprotoc.a $(LIBDIR)/$(CONFIG)/protobuf
    $(Q)cp third_party/protobuf/src/.libs/libprotobuf.a $(LIBDIR)/$(CONFIG)/protobuf
    $(Q)cp third_party/protobuf/src/protoc $(BINDIR)/$(CONFIG)/protobuf

So, first, you need to compile everything in two passes. Meaning you can't simply do `make` any longer, and you've got to identify the portions you actually want on either side. More on that in a moment.

Second, the Makefile isn't the appropriate location for trying to cross compile protobuf. In fact, special care has to be taken in order to properly cross compile protobuf, and doing these as separate steps is needed. We should rather disable compiling protobuf if we detect we are cross compiling, but that's not a straightforward test. See https://github.com/google/protobuf/tree/master/src for the "Note for cross-compiling" section.

And very much similar to what protobuf is doing, one needs to compile the plugins natively in one first pass:

`make plugins`

then cross compile the grpc library in a second pass. The exact target depends on what you actually want as a result, but I'm going to guess C++ static libraries, which is the reasonable choice for cross compiling:

`make HAS_PKG_CONFIG=false CC=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-gcc CXX=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-g++ RANLIB=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-ranlib LD=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-ld static`

The important change in there is the `static` keyword at the end.

I already checked  https://github.com/google/protobuf/tree/master/src for the "Note for cross-compiling" section.
So, ptorobuf cross compiling is done. 
And then, I try to cross compile for grpc

> CPPFLAGS=-I/arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi/include LDFLAGS=-//arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi//lib 
> make HAS_PKG_CONFIG=false CC=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-gcc CXX=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-g++ LD=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-ld LDXX=arm-xxxx-linux-gnueabi-ldd static

These are all pre-steps  about cpp_grpc_plugin error.

I have some questions about plugin compile.
- Where at ? grpc or protobuf
- Results about 'make plugins'.
- I would like to know reason of error exactly.

Hi yookyoung,

I haven't cross-compiled gRPC successfully yet due to the lack of time but can you also try with CMake?

Recently CMakeLists.txt were merged into the master branch for cross compile support.
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/6997
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt

If you face any problems with CMake, please refer to the following issue report.
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/7233

Thanks,
Daniel

Can you try with up-to-date CMakeLists.txt?
There was a patch to fix another issue which was reported in #7233

Did you get this error even though you used "cmake"? Then please report the issue to @tberghammer who is the author of CMakeLists.txt. It'll be great if you CC me to that thread.
I am getting this same plugin error compiling for mipsle.   I would like to try with the cmake as suggested above.  Can anyone provide the correct syntax for doing this?

I haven't tried to cross compile grpc for a while but last time I tried these were the steps necessary:
* Create a cmake toolchain file for your toolchain and target platform (https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.6/manual/cmake-toolchains.7.html#cross-compiling)
* git clone https://github.com/grpc/grpc && cd grpc && git submodule update --init
* mkdir build && cd build
* cmake .. -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=<TOOLCHAIN-FILE> -Dprotobuf_BUILD_TESTS=Off -DgRPC_INSTALL=Off
* make
There hasn't been any activity on this issue, so I am going to close it. Contributions/fixes are welcome.
